api_id.description:
The API identifier for API operations. You can retrieve this
from the Incapsula management console. Can be set via INCAPSULA_API_ID environment variable.

api_key.description:
The API key for API operations. You can retrieve this
from the Incapsula management console. Can be set via INCAPSULA_API_KEY environment variable.

base_url.description: The base URL for API operations. Used for provider development.

base_url_api.description: The base URL (same as v2 but with different subdomain) for API operations. Used for provider development.

base_url_rev_2.description: The base URL (revision 2) for API operations. Used for provider development.

base_url_rev_3.description: The base URL (revision 3) for API operations. Used for provider development.

account_id.description: The account these websites belongs to.

auto_publish.description: Whether to publish the changes automatically. Changes don't take take effect until they have been published.

last_publish.description: When the last publish was done for this terraform resource. Changes are published when `auto_publish` is true and the terraform config is applied.

name.description: Name for the website group. Must be unique unless `name_id` is specified.

name_id.description: Unique user-defined identifier used to differentiate website groups whose `name` is identical

enable_mitigation.description: Enables the ABP conditions for this website. Defaults to true.

block.description: List of websites within the website group. Websites are matched in a top-down fashion. If a more specific website should take precedence over over a wild card entry then that should be higher in the list

List of website groups which are associated to ABP. Website groups are matched in a top-down fashion. If a more specific website group should take precedence over over a wild card entry then that should be higher in the list.

Provides an Incapsula ABP (Advanced Bot Protection) website resource. Allows you to enable and configure ABP for given websites.

NOTE: Due to limitations in ABP, the API key/id used to deploy this resource must match the `account_id` used in the resource (API key/id for a parent account do not work). All Incapsula sites associated with the resource must also be defined in that account.

consent_required.description: Blocks Imperva from performing sensitive operations on your behalf. Options are `true`, `false`.

data_storage_region.description: Default data region of the account for newly created sites. Options are `APAC`, `EU`, `US` and `DEFAULT`. Defaults to `DEFAULT`.

enable_http2_for_new_sites.description: Enable HTTP/2 for traffic between end-users (visitors) and Imperva for newly created SSL sites. Options are `true` and `false`. Defaults to `true`

enable_http2_to_origin_for_new_sites.description: Enable HTTP/2 support for traffic between Imperva and your origin server for newly created SSL sites. This option can only be 'true' once 'enable_http2_for_new_sites' is enabled for newly created sites. Options are `true` and `false`. Defaults to `false`

error_page_template.description: Base64 encoded template for an error page.

log_level.description: The log level. Options are `full`, `security`, and `none`.

logs_account_id.description: Available only for Enterprise Plan customers that purchased the Logs Integration SKU. Numeric identifier of the account that purchased the logs integration SKU and which collects the logs. If not specified, operation will be performed on the account identified by the authentication parameters.

naked_domain_san_for_new_www_sites.description: Add naked domain SAN to Incapsula SSL certificates for new www sites. Options are `true` and `false`. Defaults to `true`

parent_id.description: The newly created account's parent id. If not specified, the invoking account will be assigned as the parent.

plan_id.description: An identifier of the plan to assign to the new account. For example, ent100 for the Enterprise 100 plan.

plan_name.description: Name of plan associate with account

ref_id.description: Customer specific identifier for this operation.

support_all_tls_versions.description: Allow sites in the account to support all TLS versions for connectivity between clients (visitors) and the Imperva service.

user_name.description: The account owner's name. For example: John Doe.

wildcard_san_for_new_sites.description: Add wildcard SAN to Incapsula SSL certificates for new sites. Options are `true`, `false` and `default`. Defaults to `default`

account_id.description: The account Id.

available_policy_ids.description: Comma separated list of The account’s available policies. These policies can be applied to the websites in the account. e.g. available_policy_ids = format("%s,%s", incapsula_policy.acl1-policy.id, incapsula_policy.waf3-policy.id) Specify this argument only if you are a parent account trying to update your child account policies availability in order to remove availability for all policies please specify "NO_AVAILABLE_POLICIES".

default_non_mandatory_policy_ids.description: This list is currently relevant to whitelist and acl policies. More than one policy can be set as default. providing an empty list or omitting this argument will clear all the non mandatory default policies.

default_waf_policy_id.description:
The WAF policy which is set as default to the account. The account can only have 1 such id.
 The Default policy will be applied automatically to sites that were create after setting it to default.

account_id.description: Numeric identifier of the account to operate on.

permissions.description: List of account permission keys that the role contains.

account_id.description: Numeric identifier of the account to operate on.

add_naked_domain_san_for_www_sites.description: Add naked domain SAN on the Imperva generated certificate for newly created WWW sites.

allow_cname_validation.description: Allow Imperva to prove ownership on the domains under the allowed_domains_for_cname_validation list on behalf of the customer.

allow_support_old_tls_versions.description: When true, sites under the account or sub-accounts can allow support of old TLS versions traffic. This can be configured only on the parent account level.

enable_hsts_for_new_sites.description: When true, enables HSTS support for newly created websites.

use_wild_card_san_instead_of_fqdn.description: Add wildcard SAN instead of FQDN SAN on the Imperva generated certificate for newly created sites.

cname_record_host.description: The CNAME record value to use to configure this domain for delegation.

cname_record_value.description: The CNAME record host to use.

last_status_check.description: The domain last status check date.

block.description: The list of domains that Imperva allow to prove ownership on, on behalf of the customer.

account_id.description: Unique ID of the required account . example: 123456

email.description: Email address. For example: joe@example.com. example: userEmail@imperva.com

first_name.description: The first name of the user that was acted on. example: John

last_name.description: The last name of the user that was acted on. example: Snow

role_ids.description: List of role ids to add to the user.

api_specification.description: The API specification document content. The supported format is OAS2 or OAS3

base_path.description: Override the spec basePath / server base path with this value

description.description: A description that will help recognize the API in the dashboard

host_name.description: The host name from the swagger file

invalid_method_violation_action.description: The action taken when an invalid method Violation occurs. Possible values: ALERT_ONLY, BLOCK_REQUEST, BLOCK_USER, BLOCK_IP, IGNORE, DEFAULT. Assigning DEFAULT will inherit the action from parent object

invalid_param_name_violation_action.description: The violation action taken when invalid request parameter name was sent. Possible values: ALERT_ONLY, BLOCK_REQUEST, BLOCK_USER, BLOCK_IP, IGNORE, DEFAULT. Assigning DEFAULT will inherit the action from parent object

invalid_param_value_violation_action.description: The action taken when an invalid parameter value Violation occurs. Possible values: ALERT_ONLY, BLOCK_REQUEST, BLOCK_USER, BLOCK_IP, IGNORE, DEFAULT. Assigning DEFAULT will inherit the action from parent object

invalid_url_violation_action.description: The violation action taken when invalid URL was used. Possible values: ALERT_ONLY, BLOCK_REQUEST, BLOCK_USER, BLOCK_IP, IGNORE, DEFAULT. Assigning DEFAULT will inherit the action from parent object

missing_param_violation_action.description: The action taken when a missing parameter Violation occurs. Possible values: ALERT_ONLY, BLOCK_REQUEST, BLOCK_USER, BLOCK_IP, IGNORE, DEFAULT. Assigning DEFAULT will inherit the action from parent object

site_id.description: Numeric identifier of the site to operate on.

api_id.description: The site ID which API security is configured on.

invalid_param_name_violation_action.description: The action taken when an invalid parameter name Violation occurs. Possible values: ALERT_ONLY, BLOCK_REQUEST, BLOCK_USER, BLOCK_IP, IGNORE, DEFAULT. Assigning DEFAULT will inherit the action from parent object.

invalid_param_value_violation_action.description: The action taken when an invalid parameter value Violation occurs. Possible values: ALERT_ONLY, BLOCK_REQUEST, BLOCK_USER, BLOCK_IP, IGNORE, DEFAULT. Assigning DEFAULT will inherit the action from parent object.

method.description: HTTP method that describes a specific endpoint. Possible values: POST, GET, PUT, PATCH, DELETE, HEAD, OPTIONS

missing_param_violation_action.description: The action taken when an invalid URL Violation occurs. Possible values: ALERT_ONLY, BLOCK_REQUEST, BLOCK_USER, BLOCK_IP, IGNORE, DEFAULT. Assigning DEFAULT will inherit the action from parent object.

path.description: An URL path of specific endpoint

invalid_method_violation_action.description: The action taken when an invalid method Violation occurs. Possible values: ALERT_ONLY, BLOCK_REQUEST, BLOCK_USER, BLOCK_IP, IGNORE, DEFAULT.

invalid_param_name_violation_action.description: The action taken when an invalid parameter value Violation occurs. Possible values: ALERT_ONLY, BLOCK_REQUEST, BLOCK_USER, BLOCK_IP, IGNORE, DEFAULT.

invalid_param_value_violation_action.description: The action taken when an invalid parameter value Violation occurs. Possible values: ALERT_ONLY, BLOCK_REQUEST, BLOCK_USER, BLOCK_IP, IGNORE, DEFAULT.

invalid_url_violation_action.description: The action taken when an invalid URL Violation occurs. Possible values: ALERT_ONLY, BLOCK_REQUEST, BLOCK_USER, BLOCK_IP, IGNORE.

is_api_only_site.description: Apply positive security model for all traffic on the site. Applying the positive security model for all traffic on the site may lead to undesired request blocking.

is_automatic_discovery_api_integration_e.description: Parameter shows whether automatic API discovery is enabled

missing_param_violation_action.description: The action taken when a missing parameter Violation occurs. Possible values: ALERT_ONLY, BLOCK_REQUEST, BLOCK_USER, BLOCK_IP, IGNORE, DEFAULT.

non_api_request_violation_action.description: Action to be taken for traffic on the site that does not target the uploaded APIs. Possible values: ALERT_ONLY, BLOCK_REQUEST, BLOCK_USER, BLOCK_IP, IGNORE.

site_id.description: The Site ID of the the site the API security is configured on.

aggressive_compression.description: A more aggressive method of compression is applied with the goal of minimizing the image file size, possibly impacting the final quality of the image displayed. Applies to JPEG compression only.

compress_jpeg.description: Compress JPEG images. Compression reduces download time by reducing the file size.

compress_png.description: Compress PNG images. Compression reduces download time by reducing the file size. PNG compression removes only image meta-data with no impact on quality.

compression_type.description: Gzip (default). Brotli (recommended for more efficient compression)

default_error_page_template.description: The default error page HTML template. $TITLE$ and $BODY$ placeholders are required.

enable_http2.description: Allows supporting browsers to take advantage of the performance enhancements provided by HTTP/2 for your website. Non-supporting browsers can connect via HTTP/1.0 or HTTP/1.1.

error_abp_identification_failed.description: The inner HTML template for 'ABP identification failed' error. Only HTML elements located inside the body tag are supported. Set empty value to return to default.

error_access_denied.description: The HTML template for 'Access Denied' error. $TITLE$ and $BODY$ placeholders are required. Set empty value to return to default.

error_connection_failed.description: The HTML template for 'Unable to connect to origin server' error. $TITLE$ and $BODY$ placeholders are required. Set empty value to return to default.

error_connection_timeout.description: The HTML template for 'Connection Timeout' error. $TITLE$ and $BODY$ placeholders are required. Set empty value to return to default.

error_deny_and_captcha.description: The HTML template for 'Initial connection denied - CAPTCHA required' error. $TITLE$ and $BODY$ placeholders are required. Set empty value to return to default.

error_no_ssl_config.description: The HTML template for 'Site not configured for SSL' error. $TITLE$ and $BODY$ placeholders are required. Set empty value to return to default.

error_parse_req_error.description: The HTML template for 'Unable to parse request' error. $TITLE$ and $BODY$ placeholders are required. Set empty value to return to default.

error_parse_resp_error.description: The HTML template for 'Unable to parse response' error. $TITLE$ and $BODY$ placeholders are required. Set empty value to return to default.

error_ssl_failed.description: The HTML template for 'Unable to establish SSL connection' error. $TITLE$ and $BODY$ placeholders are required. Set empty value to return to default.

file_compression.description: When this option is enabled, files such as JavaScript, CSS and HTML are dynamically compressed using the selected format as they are transferred. They are automatically unzipped within the browser. If Brotli is not supported by the browser, files are automatically sent in Gzip.

http2_to_origin.description: Enables HTTP/2 for the connection between Imperva and your origin server. (HTTP/2 must also be supported by the origin server.)

minify_css.description: Content minification can applied only to cached Javascript, CSS and HTML content.

minify_js.description: Minify JavaScript. Minification removes characters that are not necessary for rendering the page, such as whitespace and comments. This makes the files smaller and therefore reduces their access time. Minification has no impact on the functionality of the Javascript, CSS, and HTML files.

origin_connection_reuse.description: TCP connections that are opened for a client request remain open for a short time to handle additional requests that may arrive.

port_to.description: The port number. If field is set to 80 (the default value), rewrite port will be removed.

progressive_image_rendering.description: The image is rendered with progressively finer resolution, potentially causing a pixelated effect until the final image is rendered with no loss of quality. This option reduces page load times and allows images to gradually load after the page is rendered.

redirect_http_to_https.description: Sites that require an HTTPS connection force all HTTP requests to be redirected to HTTPS. This option is displayed only for an SSL site.

redirect_naked_to_full.description: Redirect all visitors to your site’s full domain (which includes www). This option is displayed only for a naked domain.

site_id.description: Numeric identifier of the site to operate on.

ssl_port_to.description: The port number to rewrite default SSL port to. if field is set to 443 (the default value), rewrite SSL port will be removed.

support_non_sni_clients.description: By default, non-SNI clients are supported. Disable this option to block non-SNI clients.

tcp_pre_pooling.description: Maintain a set of idle TCP connections to the origin server to eliminate the latency associated with opening new connections or new requests (TCP handshake).

account_id.description: Account ID that the site belongs to.

endpoint_id.description: Endpoint ID associated with this request

mitigation_action_for_high_risk.description: Mitigation action configured for high risk requests - in UPPER CASE.

mitigation_action_for_low_risk.description: Mitigation action configured for low risk requests - in UPPER CASE.

mitigation_action_for_medium_risk.description: Mitigation action configured for medium risk requests - in UPPER CASE.

site_id.description: Site ID to get the allowlist for.

account_id.description: Account ID that the site belongs to.

allowlist.description: The allowlist of IPs and IP ranges for the given site ID

site_id.description: Site ID to get the allowlist for.

bad_bots.description: List of bots for Bad Bots configuration

canceled_good_bots.description: List of bots for Canceled Good Bots configuration

site_id.description: Numeric identifier of the site to operate on.

action.description: Rule action. See the detailed descriptions in the API documentation. Possible values: `HTTP_CACHE_MAKE_STATIC`, `HTTP_CACHE_CLIENT_CACHE_CTL`, `HTTP_CACHE_FORCE_UNCACHEABLE`, `HTTP_CACHE_ADD_TAG`, `HTTP_CACHE_DIFFERENTIATE_SSL`, `HTTP_CACHE_DIFFERENTIATE_BY_HEADER`, `HTTP_CACHE_DIFFERENTIATE_BY_COOKIE`, `HTTP_CACHE_DIFFERENTIATE_BY_GEO`, `HTTP_CACHE_IGNORE_PARAMS`, `HTTP_CACHE_ENRICH_CACHE_KEY`, `HTTP_CACHE_FORCE_VALIDATION`, `HTTP_CACHE_IGNORE_AUTH_HEADER`.

differentiate_by_value.description: Value to differentiate resources by. Relevant for `HTTP_CACHE_DIFFERENTIATE_BY_HEADER`, `HTTP_CACHE_DIFFERENTIATE_BY_COOKIE` and `HTTP_CACHE_DIFFERENTIATE_BY_GEO` actions.

enabled.description: Boolean that specifies if the rule should be enabled.

filter.description: The filter defines the conditions that trigger the rule action, if left empty, the rule is always run.

ignored_params.description: Parameters to ignore. Relevant for `HTTP_CACHE_IGNORE_PARAMS` action. An array containing `'*'` means all parameters are ignored.

site_id.description: Numeric identifier of the site to operate on.

text.description: Tag name if action is `HTTP_CACHE_ADD_TAG` action, text to be added to the cache key as suffix if action is `HTTP_CACHE_ENRICH_CACHE_KEY`.

ttl.description: TTL in seconds. Relevant for `HTTP_CACHE_MAKE_STATIC` and `HTTP_CACHE_CLIENT_CACHE_CTL` actions.

account_id.description: Numeric identifier of the account to operate on.

email_addresses.description: Email address for the event notification recipient list of a specific website. Notifications are reasonably small and limited in frequency

mode.description:
Website Protection Mode. When in "enforce" mode, blocked resources will not be available in the application and new resources will be automatically blocked. When in "monitor" mode, all resources are available in the application and the system keeps track of all new domains that are discovered.
Values: monitor\enforce\off

site_id.description: Numeric identifier of the site to operate on.

account_id.description: Numeric identifier of the account to operate on.

domain.description: The fully qualified domain name of the site. For example: www.example.com, hello.example.com.

include_subdomains.description: Defines Whether or not subdomains will inherit the allowance of the parent domain. Values: true, false

notes.description: Add a quick note to a domain to help in future analysis and investigation. You can add as many notes as you like.

site_id.description: Numeric identifier of the site to operate on.

status.description: Defines whether the domain should be Blocked or Allowed once the site's mode changes to the Enforcement. Values: Blocked, Allowed

auth_type.description: The authentication type of the certificate (RSA or ECC). Optional. If not provided, then RSA will be assume.

certificate.description: The certificate file in base64 format.

passphrase.description: The passphrase used to protect your SSL certificate. This will be encoded in sha256 in terraform state.

private_key.description: The private key of the certificate in base64 format. Optional in case of PFX certificate file format. This will be encoded in sha256 in terraform state.

site_id.description: Numeric identifier of the site to operate on.

certificate.description: The certificate file in base64 format.

site_id.description: Numeric identifier of the site to operate on.

api_id.description: The api id of the hsm server

api_key.description: the api key in of the hsm server

hostname.description: The hostname of the hsm server

block.description: The details of the API in Fortanix

is_content.description: The data center will be available for specific resources (Forward Delivery Rules).

server_address.description: The server's address. Possible values: IP, CNAME.

site_id.description: Numeric identifier of the site to operate on.

dc_id.description: Numeric identifier of the data center server to operate on.

is_standby.description: Set the server as Active (P0) or Standby (P1).

site_id.description: Numeric identifier of the site to operate on.

fail_over_required_monitors.description: How many Imperva PoPs should assess Data Center as down before failover is performed.

is_persistent.description: When true our proxy servers will maintain session stickiness to origin servers by a cookie.

kickstart_password.description: Password, if required by the kickstart URL.

kickstart_url.description: The URL that will be sent to the standby server when Imperva performs failover based on our monitoring. E.g. https://www.example.com/kickStart

kickstart_user.description: User name, if required by the kickstart URL.

min_available_servers_for_dc_up.description: The minimal number of available data center's servers to consider that data center as UP

site_id.description: Numeric identifier of the site to operate on.

site_lb_algorithm.description: How to load balance between multiple Data Centers.

site_topology.description: One of: 'SINGLE_SERVER' - No LB supported, 'SINGLE_DC' - Multiple servers on single Data Center, or 'MULTIPLE_DC' - Multiple Data Centers having multiple origin servers.

dc_lb_algorithm.description: How to load balance between the servers of this data center.

geo_locations.description: List of geo regions that this data center will serve. Mandatory if site_lb_algorithm = GEO_PREFERRED or GEO_REQUIRED. E.g. "ASIA,AFRICA"

ip_mode.description: SINGLE_IP supports multiple processes on same origin server each listening to a different port, MULTIPLE_IP support multiple origin servers all listening to same port.

is_active.description: Specifies if the Data Center is an active or a standby Data Center. No more than one standby Data Center can be defined.

is_content.description: When true, this data center will only handle requests that were routed to it using application delivery forward rules. If true, must be an enabled data center.

is_enabled.description: Specifies if the Data Center is enabled.

is_rest_of_the_world.description: When true and site_lb_algorithm = GEO_PREFERRED or GEO_REQUIRED, exactly one data center must have is_rest_of_the_world = true. This data center will handle traffic from any region that is not assigned to a specific data center.

origin_pop.description: The ID of the PoP that serves as an access point between Imperva and the customer’s origin server. E.g. "lax", for Los Angeles. When not specified, all Imperva PoPs can send traffic to this data center. The list of available PoPs is documented at: https://docs.imperva.com/bundle/cloud-application-security/page/more/pops.htm

web_servers_per_server.description: When IP mode = SINGLE_IP, number of web servers (processes) per server. Each web server listens to different port. E.g. when web_servers_per_server = 5, HTTP traffic will use ports 80-84 while HTTPS traffic will use ports 443-447

weight.description: When site_lb_algorithm = WEIGHTED_LB, the weight in pecentage of this Data Center. Then, total weight of all Data Centers must be 100.

address.description: Origin server address. can be specified as IPv4, IPv6, or DNS host name.

is_active.description: Specifies if the origin server is an active or a standby origin server.

is_enabled.description: Specifies if the origin server is enabled.

weight.description: When dc_lb_algorithm = WEIGHTED, the weight in pecentage of this origin server. Then, total weight of all origin server on each Data Center must be 100.

block.description: A set of Data Centers and their Origin Servers

category.description: How to load balance between multiple Data Centers.

site_id.description: Numeric identifier of the site to operate on.

add_if_missing.description: Rewrite rule would add the header/cookie if it's missing

dc_id.description: Data center ID to forward the request to

error_response_data.description: The response returned when the request matches the filter and is blocked

error_response_format.description: The format of the given error response in the error_response_data field

error_type.description: The error that triggers the rule

filter.description: Defines the conditions that trigger the rule action

port_forwarding_value.description: Port number or header name for port forwarding

rewrite_existing.description: Apply rewrite rule even if the header/cookie already exists

action.description: Rule action. See the detailed descriptions in the API documentation. Possible values: `RULE_ACTION_REDIRECT`, `RULE_ACTION_SIMPLIFIED_REDIRECT`, `RULE_ACTION_REWRITE_URL`, `RULE_ACTION_REWRITE_HEADER`, `RULE_ACTION_REWRITE_COOKIE`, `RULE_ACTION_DELETE_HEADER`, `RULE_ACTION_DELETE_COOKIE`, `RULE_ACTION_RESPONSE_REWRITE_HEADER`, `RULE_ACTION_RESPONSE_DELETE_HEADER`, `RULE_ACTION_RESPONSE_REWRITE_RESPONSE_CODE`, `RULE_ACTION_FORWARD_TO_DC`, `RULE_ACTION_ALERT`, `RULE_ACTION_BLOCK`, `RULE_ACTION_BLOCK_USER`, `RULE_ACTION_BLOCK_IP`, `RULE_ACTION_RETRY`, `RULE_ACTION_INTRUSIVE_HTML`, `RULE_ACTION_CAPTCHA`, `RULE_ACTION_RATE`, `RULE_ACTION_CUSTOM_ERROR_RESPONSE`

add_missing.description: Add cookie or header if it doesn't exist (Rewrite cookie rule only).

dc_id.description: Data center to forward request to. Applies only for `RULE_ACTION_FORWARD_TO_DC`.

error_response_data.description: The response returned when the request matches the filter and is blocked. Applies only for `RULE_ACTION_CUSTOM_ERROR_RESPONSE`.

error_response_format.description: The format of the given error response in the error_response_data field. Applies only for `RULE_ACTION_CUSTOM_ERROR_RESPONSE`. Possible values: `json`, `xml`.

error_type.description: The error that triggers the rule. `error.type.all` triggers the rule regardless of the error type. Applies only for `RULE_ACTION_CUSTOM_ERROR_RESPONSE`. Possible values: `error.type.all`, `error.type.connection_timeout`, `error.type.access_denied`, `error.type.parse_req_error`, `error.type.parse_resp_error`, `error.type.connection_failed`, `error.type.deny_and_retry`, `error.type.ssl_failed`, `error.type.deny_and_captcha`, `error.type.2fa_required`, `error.type.no_ssl_config`, `error.type.no_ipv6_config`.

filter.description: The filter defines the conditions that trigger the rule action. For action `RULE_ACTION_SIMPLIFIED_REDIRECT` filter is not relevant. For other actions, if left empty, the rule is always run.

from.description: Pattern to rewrite. For `RULE_ACTION_REWRITE_URL` - Url to rewrite. For `RULE_ACTION_REWRITE_HEADER` and `RULE_ACTION_RESPONSE_REWRITE_HEADER` - Header value to rewrite. For `RULE_ACTION_REWRITE_COOKIE` - Cookie value to rewrite.

multiple_deletions.description: Delete multiple header occurrences. Applies only to rules using `RULE_ACTION_DELETE_HEADER` and `RULE_ACTION_RESPONSE_DELETE_HEADER`.

override_waf_action.description: The action for the override rule. Possible values: Alert Only, Block Request, Block User, Block IP, Ignore.

override_waf_rule.description: The setting to override. Possible values: SQL Injection, Remote File Inclusion, Cross Site Scripting, Illegal Resource Access.

port_forwarding_context.description: Context for port forwarding. "Use Port Value" or "Use Header Name". Applies only for `RULE_ACTION_FORWARD_TO_PORT`.

port_forwarding_value.description: Port number or header name for port forwarding. Applies only for `RULE_ACTION_FORWARD_TO_PORT`.

rate_context.description: The context of the rate counter. Possible values `IP` or `Session`. Applies only to rules using `RULE_ACTION_RATE`.

rate_interval.description: The interval in seconds of the rate counter. Possible values is a multiple of `10`; minimum `10` and maximum `300`. Applies only to rules using `RULE_ACTION_RATE`.

response_code.description: For `RULE_ACTION_REDIRECT` or `RULE_ACTION_SIMPLIFIED_REDIRECT` rule's response code, valid values are `302`, `301`, `303`, `307`, `308`. For `RULE_ACTION_RESPONSE_REWRITE_RESPONSE_CODE` rule's response code, valid values are all 3-digits numbers. For `RULE_ACTION_CUSTOM_ERROR_RESPONSE`, valid values are `400`, `401`, `402`, `403`, `404`, `405`, `406`, `407`, `408`, `409`, `410`, `411`, `412`, `413`, `414`, `415`, `416`, `417`, `419`, `420`, `422`, `423`, `424`, `500`, `501`, `502`, `503`, `504`, `505`, `507`.

rewrite_existing.description: Rewrite cookie or header if it exists.

rewrite_name.description: Name of cookie or header to rewrite. Applies only for `RULE_ACTION_REWRITE_COOKIE`, `RULE_ACTION_REWRITE_HEADER` and `RULE_ACTION_RESPONSE_REWRITE_HEADER`.

site_id.description: Numeric identifier of the site to operate on.

to.description: Pattern to change to. `RULE_ACTION_REWRITE_URL` - Url to change to. `RULE_ACTION_REWRITE_HEADER` and `RULE_ACTION_RESPONSE_REWRITE_HEADER` - Header value to change to. `RULE_ACTION_REWRITE_COOKIE` - Cookie value to change to.

account_id.description: Account ID to operte on

certificate.description: The certificate file in base64 format.

certificate_id.description: The certificate file in base64 format.

site_id.description: The certificate file in base64 format.

fingerprints.description: Permitted client certificate fingerprints. If left empty, all fingerprints are permitted. Default - empty list.

forward_to_origin.description: When set to true, the contents specified in headerValue are sent to the origin server in the header specified by headerName. Default - false. If parameter is set to true, specify of `header_name`, `header_value` are required.

header_name.description: The name of the header to send header content in. By default, the header name is 'clientCertificateInfo'. Specifying this parameter is relevant only if `forward_to_origin` is set to true.

header_value.description: The content to send in the header specified by headerName. One of the following: FULL_CERT (for full certificate in Base64) COMMON_NAME (for certificate's common name (CN)) FINGERPRINT (for the certificate fingerprints in SHA1) SERIAL_NUMBER (for the certificate's serial number). Specifying this parameter is relevant only if `forward_to_origin` is set to true.

hosts.description: The hosts on which client certificate authentication is supported. If left empty, client certificates are supported on all hosts. Default: empty list.

is_disable_session_resumption.description: Disables SSL session resumption for site. Needed when Incapsula Client Certificate is needed only for specific hosts/ports and site have clients that reuse TLS session across different hosts/ports. Default: false.

is_hosts_exception.description: When set to true, client certificates are not supported on the hosts listed in the Hosts field ('blacklisted'). Default - false.

is_ports_exception.description: When set to true, client certificates are not supported on the ports listed in the Ports field ('blacklisted'). Default - false.

ports.description: The ports on which client certificate authentication is supported. If left empty, client certificates are supported on all ports. Default: empty list

require_client_certificate.description: When set to true, the end user is required to present the client certificate in order to access the site. Default - false.

site_id.description: Numeric identifier of the site to operate on.

account_id.description: Numeric identifier of the account to operate on. If not specified, operation will be performed on the account identified by the authentication parameters.

certificate.description: Your mTLS client certificate file in base64 format. Supported formats: PEM, DER and PFX. Only RSA certificates are currently supported. The certificate RSA key size must be 2048 bit or less. The certificate must be issued by a certificate authority (CA) and cannot be self-signed.

certificate_name.description: A descriptive name for your mTLS client certificate.

input_hash.description: Currently ignored. If terraform plan flags this field as changed, it means that any of: certificate, private_key, or passphrase has changed.

passphrase.description: Your private key passphrase. Leave empty if the private key is not password protected.

private_key.description: Your private key file in base64 format. Supported formats: PEM, DER. If PFX certificate is used, then this field can remain empty.

certificate_id.description: The certificate file in base64 format.

site_id.description: The certificate file in base64 format.

account_id.description: Account ID

apply_to_new_assets.description:
If value is ‘TRUE’, all newly onboarded assets are automatically added to the notification policy's assets list.
Default value is no

apply_to_new_sub_accounts.description:
If value is ‘TRUE’, all newly onboarded sub accounts are automatically added to the notification policy's sub account list.
Default value is no

emailchannel_external_recipient_list.description: List of external email to get the notifications (not Imperva users)

emailchannel_user_recipient_list.description: List of Imperva users id to get the notifications

policy_type.description:
If value is ‘ACCOUNT’, the policy will apply only to the current account. 
If the value is 'SUB_ACCOUNT' the policy applies to the sub accounts only. 
 The parent account will receive notifications for activity in the sub accounts that are specified in the subAccountList parameter.
This parameter is available only in accounts that can contain sub accounts.

status.description: Indicates whether policy is enabled or disabled. Default value is ENABLE

sub_account_list.description: The policy ID. During update must be equal to the updated policy ID.

sub_category.description: Subtype of notification policy. Example values include: ‘account_notifications’; ‘website_notifications’; ‘certificate_management_notifications’

block.description:
Assets to receive notifications (if assets are relevant to the sub category type). 
Object struct:
assetType: the asset type. Example: websites, router connections, network prefixes, individual IPs, Flow exporters
assetId: the asset id.

dc_id.description: Numeric identifier of the data center.

origin_pop.description: The Origin POP code (must be lowercase), e.g: iad. Note, this field is create/update only. Reads are not supported as the API doesn't exist yet. Note that drift may happen.

site_id.description: Numeric identifier of the site.

account_id.description: The Account ID of the policy.

policy_settings.description: The policy settings as JSON string. See Imperva documentation for help with constructing a correct value.

policy_type.description: The policy type. Possible values: ACL, WHITELIST, WAF_RULES

account_id.description: The Asset's Account ID

asset_id.description: The Asset ID for the asset association. Only type of asset supported at the moment is site.

asset_type.description: The Policy type for the asset association. Only value at the moment is `WEBSITE`.

policy_id.description: The Policy ID for the asset association.

client_app_types.description: A comma separated list of client application types,

client_apps.description: A comma separated list of client application IDs.

continents.description: A comma separated list of continent codes.

countries.description: A comma separated list of country codes.

exception_id_only.description: The id (an integer) of the whitelist to be set. This field is optional - in case no id is supplied, a new whitelist will be created.

ips.description: A comma separated list of IPs or IP ranges, e.g: 192.168.1.1, 192.168.1.1-192.168.1.100 or 192.168.1.1/24

parameters.description: A comma separated list of encoded parameters.

rule_id.description: The identifier of the security rule, e.g api.threats.cross_site_scripting.

site_id.description: Numeric identifier of the site to operate on.

url_patterns.description: A comma separated list of url patterns. One of: contains | equals | prefix | suffix | not_equals | not_contain | not_prefix | not_suffix. The patterns should be in accordance with the matching urls sent by the urls parameter.

urls.description: A comma separated list of resource paths. For example, /home and /admin/index.html are resource paths, while http://www.example.com/home is not. Each URL should be encoded separately using percent encoding as specified by RFC 3986 (http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3986#section-2.1). An empty URL list will remove all URLs.

user_agents.description: A comma separated list of encoded user agents.

whitelist_id.description: The id (an integer) of the whitelist to be set. This field is optional - in case no id is supplied, a new whitelist will be created.

account_id.description: Client account id.

path.description: Store data from the specified connection under this path.

account_id.description: Client account id.

connection_id.description: The id of the connection for this log configuration.

datasets.description: All datasets for the supported producers.

enabled.description: True if the connection is enabled, false otherwise.

account_id.description: Client account id.

disable_cert_verification.description: flag to disable ssl cert verification

site_id.description: Numeric identifier of the site to operate on.

account_id.description: Numeric identifier of the account to operate on. If not specified, operation will be performed on the account identified by the authentication parameters.

data_storage_region.description: The data region to use. Options are `APAC`, `AU`, `EU`, and `US`.

dns_record_name.description: The DNS Record type TXT that should be created and set to the `domain_verification` output value.

domain.description: The fully qualified domain name of the site. For example: www.example.com, hello.example.com.

domain_validation.description: email or html or dns or cname.

force_ssl.description: If this value is true, manually set the site to support SSL. This option is only available for sites with manually configured IP/CNAME and for specific accounts.

hash_salt.description: Specify the hash salt (masking setting), required if hashing is enabled. Maximum length of 64 characters.

hashing_enabled.description: Specify if hashing (masking setting) should be enabled.

log_level.description: The log level. Options are `full`, `security`, and `none`.

logs_account_id.description: Available only for Enterprise Plan customers that purchased the Logs Integration SKU. Numeric identifier of the account that purchased the logs integration SKU and which collects the logs. If not specified, operation will be performed on the account identified by the authentication parameters.

naked_domain_san.description: Use 'true' to add the naked domain SAN to a www site’s SSL certificate. Default value: true

original_data_center_id.description: Numeric representation of the data center created with the site.

perf_client_comply_no_cache.description: Comply with No-Cache and Max-Age directives in client requests. By default, these cache directives are ignored. Resources are dynamically profiled and re-configured to optimize performance.

perf_client_enable_client_side_caching.description: Cache content on client browsers or applications. When not enabled, content is cached only on the Imperva proxies.

perf_client_send_age_header.description: Send Cache-Control: max-age and Age headers.

perf_key_comply_vary.description: Comply with Vary. Cache resources in accordance with the Vary response header.

perf_key_unite_naked_full_cache.description: Use the Same Cache for Full and Naked Domains. For example, use the same cached resource for www.example.com/a and example.com/a.

perf_mode_https.description: The resources that are cached over HTTPS, the general level applies. Options are `disabled`, `dont_include_html`, `include_html`, and `include_all_resources`.

perf_mode_time.description: The time, in seconds, that you set for this option determines how often the cache is refreshed. Relevant for the `include_html` and `include_all_resources` levels only.

perf_response_cache_300x.description: When this option is checked Imperva will cache 301, 302, 303, 307, and 308 redirect response headers containing the target URI.

perf_response_cache_404_enabled.description: Whether or not to cache 404 responses.

perf_response_cache_404_time.description: The time in seconds to cache 404 responses.

perf_response_cache_empty_responses.description: Cache responses that don’t have a message body.

perf_response_cache_http_10_responses.description: Cache HTTP 1.0 type responses that don’t include the Content-Length header or chunking.

perf_response_cache_response_header_mode.description: The working mode for caching response headers. Options are `all` and `custom`.

perf_response_cache_response_headers.description: An array of strings representing the response headers to be cached when working in `custom` mode. If empty, no response headers are cached.

perf_response_cache_shield.description: Adds an intermediate cache between other Imperva PoPs and your origin servers to protect your servers from redundant requests.

perf_response_stale_content_mode.description: The working mode for serving stale content. Options are `disabled`, `adaptive`, and `custom`.

perf_response_stale_content_time.description: The time, in seconds, to serve stale content for when working in `custom` work mode.

perf_response_tag_response_header.description: Tag the response according to the value of this header. Specify which origin response header contains the cache tags in your resources.

perf_ttl_prefer_last_modified.description: Prefer 'Last Modified' over eTag. When this option is checked, Imperva prefers using Last Modified values (if available) over eTag values (recommended on multi-server setups).

perf_ttl_use_shortest_caching.description: Use shortest caching duration in case of conflicts. By default, the longest duration is used in case of conflict between caching rules or modes. When this option is checked, Imperva uses the shortest duration in case of conflict.

ref_id.description: Customer specific identifier for this operation.

restricted_cname_reuse.description: Use this option to allow Imperva to detect and add domains that are using the Imperva-provided CNAME (not recommended). One of: true | false

seal_location.description: api.seal_location.bottom_left | api.seal_location.none | api.seal_location.right_bottom | api.seal_location.right | api.seal_location.left | api.seal_location.bottom_right | api.seal_location.bottom.

send_site_setup_emails.description: If this value is false, end users will not get emails about the add site process such as DNS instructions and SSL setup.

site_creation_date.description: Numeric representation of the site creation date.

site_ip.description: Manually set the web server IP/CNAME.

wildcard_san.description: Use 'true' to add the wildcard SAN or 'false' to add the full domain SAN to the site’s SSL certificate. Default value: true

cname_redirection_record.description: Cname record for traffic redirection. Point your domain's DNS to this record in order to forward the traffic to Imperva

site_id.description: Numeric identifier of the site to operate on.

id.description: Numeric identifier of the domain on Imperva service

status.description: Status of the domain. Indicates if domain DNS is pointed to Imperva's CNAME. Options: BYPASSED, VERIFIED, PROTECTED, MISCONFIGURED

alarm_on_dc_failover.description: Indicates whether or not an email will be sent upon server failover

alarm_on_server_failover.description: Indicates whether or not an email will be sent upon data center failover

alarm_on_stands_by_failover.description: Indicates whether or not an email will be sent upon failover to a standby data center

expected_received_string.description: The expected string. If left empty, any response, except for the codes defined in the HTTP response error codes to be treated as Down parameter, will be considered successful. If the value is non-empty, then the defined value must appear within the response string for the response to be considered successful.

failed_requests_duration.description: The minimum duration of failures above the threshold to consider server as down. 20-180 SECONDS or 1-2 MINUTES. Default: 40

failed_requests_duration_units.description: Time unit. Possible values: SECONDS, MINUTES. Default: SECONDS

failed_requests_min_number.description: The minimum number of of failed requests to be considered as failure

failed_requests_percentage.description: The percentage of failed requests to the origin server

http_request_timeout.description: The maximum time to wait for an HTTP response. 1-200 SECONDS or 1-2 MINUTES

http_response_error.description: The HTTP response error codes or patterns that will be counted as request failures

monitoring_url.description: The URL to use for monitoring your website.

required_monitors.description: Monitors required to report server / data center as down

site_id.description: Numeric identifier of the site to operate on.

up_check_retries.description: Every time an origin server is tested to see whether it’s back up, the test will be retried this number of times.

up_checks_interval.description: After an origin server was identified as down, Imperva will periodically test it to see whether it has recovered, according to the frequency defined in this parameter. 10-120 SECONDS or 1-2 MINUTES

use_verification_for_down.description: If Imperva determines that an origin server is down according to failed request criteria, it will initiate another request to verify that the origin server is down

site_id.description: Numeric identifier of the site to operate on.

data_storage_region.description: Default data region of the sub account for newly created sites. Options are `APAC`, `EU`, `US` and `AU`. Defaults to `DEFAULT`.

enable_http2_for_new_sites.description: Enable HTTP/2 for traffic between end-users (visitors) and Imperva for newly created SSL sites. Options are `true` and `false`. Defaults to `true`

enable_http2_to_origin_for_new_sites.description: Enable HTTP/2 support for traffic between Imperva and your origin server for newly created SSL sites. This option can only be 'true' once 'enable_http2_for_new_sites' is enabled for newly created sites. Options are `true` and `false`. Defaults to `false`

log_level.description: The log level. Options are `full`, `security`, `none` and `default`.

logs_account_id.description: Available only for Enterprise Plan customers that purchased the Logs Integration SKU. Numeric identifier of the account that purchased the logs integration SKU and which collects the logs. If not specified, operation will be performed on the account identified by the authentication parameters.

parent_id.description: The newly created account's parent id. If not specified, the invoking account will be assigned as the parent.

ref_id.description: Customer specific identifier for this operation.

sub_account_name.description: The name of the new sub-account.

site_id.description: Numeric identifier of the site.

txt_record_value_five.description: New value for txt record number five.

txt_record_value_four.description: New value for txt record number four.

txt_record_value_one.description: New value for txt record number one.

txt_record_value_three.description: New value for txt record number three.

txt_record_value_two.description: New value for txt record number two.

account_id.description: The Numeric identifier of the account to operate on.

enabled.description: A boolean flag to enable or disable WAF Logs.

sftp_destination_folder.description: The path to the directory on the SFTP server.

sftp_host.description:
The IP address of your SFTP server.
.

sftp_password.description: A corresponding password for the user account used to log in to the SFTP server.

sftp_user_name.description: A username that will be used to log in to the SFTP server.

activation_mode.description: The mode of activation for ddos on a site. Possible values: api.threats.ddos.activation_mode.off, api.threats.ddos.activation_mode.auto, api.threats.ddos.activation_mode.on.

block_bad_bots.description: Whether or not to block bad bots. Possible values: true, false.

challenge_suspected_bots.description: Whether or not to send a challenge to clients that are suspected to be bad bots (CAPTCHA for example). Possible values: true, false.

ddos_traffic_threshold.description: Consider site to be under DDoS if the request rate is above this threshold. The valid values are 10, 20, 50, 100, 200, 500, 750, 1000, 2000, 3000, 4000, 5000.

rule_id.description: The identifier of the WAF rule, e.g api.threats.cross_site_scripting.

security_rule_action.description: The action that should be taken when a threat is detected, for example: api.threats.action.block_ip.

site_id.description: Numeric identifier of the site to operate on.

account_id.description: The account this waiting room belongs to.

bots_action_in_queuing_mode.description: The waiting room bot handling action. Determines the waiting room behavior for legitimate bots trying to access your website during peak time

concurrent_sessions_threshold.description: The active users activation threshold of the waiting room. The waiting room is activated when number of active users reached specified value.

created_at.description: The waiting room creation date in milliseconds.

enabled.description: whether this waiting room is enabled or not.

entrance_rate_threshold.description: The entrance rate activation threshold of the waiting room. The waiting room is activated when sessions per minute exceed the specified value.

filter.description: The rule conditions that determine on which sessions this waiting room applies. (no filter means the waiting room applies for the whole site)

inactivity_timeout.description: If waiting room conditions that limit the scope of the waiting room to a subset of the website have been defined, the user is considered active only when navigating the pages in scope of the conditions. A user who is inactive for a longer period of time is considered as having left the site.

last_modified_at.description: The last configuration change date in milliseconds.

last_modified_by.description: The user who last modified the waiting room configuration

mode.description: The waiting room mode. Indicates whether the waiting room is currently queuing or not.

name.description: The waiting room name. Must be unique across all waiting room of the site.

queue_inactivity_timeout.description: Queue inactivity timeout. A user in the waiting room who is inactive for a longer period of time is considered as having left the queue. On returning to the site, the user moves to the end of the queue and needs to wait in line again if the waiting room is active.

site_id.description: Numeric identifier of the site to operate on.

account_id.description: Numeric identifier of the account to operate on.

filter_by_text.description: Filter by text representing the permission to fetch

keys.description: Set of ability keys ids filtered by name

map.description: Set of all the ability keys

block.description: Provides the account permission of a given account.

account_id.description: Numeric identifier of the account to operate on.

admin_role_id.description: Numeric identifier of the default Administrator role.

map.description: Set of all the account roles

reader_role_id.description: Numeric identifier of the default Reader role.

block.description: Provides the account roles of a given account.

ids.description: Set of client applications ids filtered by name

map.description: Map of all the client applications

block.description: Provides the properties of all the client applications.

filter_by_geo_location.description: Filter by assigned geo location or the Data Center, which serves the rest of the world, if the geo location is not assigned to any other Data Center.

filter_by_id.description: Filter by Data Center internal ID

filter_by_is_active.description: Filter by whether Data Center is active

filter_by_is_content.description: Filter by whether this Data Center will only handle traffic routed by Application Delivery Forward-to-DC rule.

filter_by_is_enabled.description: Filter by whether Data Center is enabled

filter_by_is_rest_of_the_world.description: Filter by whether this Data Center handles only traffic from geo regions that are not assigned to any other Data Center

filter_by_is_standby.description: Filter by whether Data Center is standby

geo_locations.description: List of geo regions that this data center will serve. Populated if Site's LB algorithm = GEO_PREFERRED or GEO_REQUIRED. E.g. "ASIA,AFRICA"

ip_mode.description: SINGLE_IP supports multiple processes on same origin server each listening to a different port, MULTIPLE_IP support multiple origin servers all listening to same port.

is_active.description: When false, Data Center in standby mode

is_content.description: When true, Data Center will only accept traffic routed by Application Delivery Forward-to-DC rule.

is_enabled.description: When true, Data Center is enabled

is_rest_of_the_world.description: When true and lb_algorithm is one of: GEO_PREFERED, GEO_REQUIRED, Then this Data Center will handle the traffic of all geo locations that are not assigned to any other Data Center

lb_algorithm.description: How to load balance between the servers of this data center.

origin_pop.description: The ID of the PoP that serves as an access point between Imperva and the customer’s origin server. E.g. "lax", for Los Angeles. When not specified, all Imperva PoPs can send traffic to this data center.

site_id.description: Site ID

weight.description: The weight in pecentage of this Data Center. Populated only when Site's LB algorithem is WEIGHTED_LB.

block.description: Provides the properties of a single Data Center. All 'filter_by_' arguments are optional. When specified, a logical AND operator is assumed.

can_assign_client_certificates.description: Manage client CA certificates for site

can_edit_client_certificates.description: Manage client CA certificates for account

can_run_connectivity_reports.description: Allow user to run connectivity reports
